originalText.text: TAHIR was amazing. He guided us through the store and gave great customer service! He helped my group find awesome items. We appreciate it! Thank you!

text.text: TAHIR was amazing. He guided us through the store and gave great customer service! He helped my group find awesome items. We appreciate it! Thank you!

originalText.text: I use to go to the 2nd Street all the time when I was in Asia so was surprised there were branches here too. Growing up in NYC checking your bag at the door is not uncommon so had no issues handing over my backpack. The selection was good but seemed strange to have thousand $ pieces right across from Old Navy used jeans. Didn't see many bargains but was fun browsing !

text.text: I use to go to the 2nd Street all the time when I was in Asia so was surprised there were branches here too. originalText.text: I am legitimately making this review in front of the store as I just left because the young guy named Patrick at reception was extremely disrespectful and lackluster towards me. I called prior to and mentioned it will be my first time and no one mentioned to me how the process works. I came in person and dude handling my clothes looked like he didn’t even want to bother with me, his attitude is nasty, and he never acknowledged me. He just took my items, and said it’ll take 45 minutes for me to get appraised. I mentioned this is my first time here and he looked pained to explain how the process works. Legit ignored me when I asked a questioned, and then I had to assertively demand action to my request. I just don’t like doing business where I don’t feel valued or treated with common courtesy or respect. I asked for my items back after some thought. He is probably having a bad day so I’m not taking it personal but it did upset me. My face is hot. I told the security guard, an employee, and the manager about this. It seemed the security guard and employee cared more than the manager which is likely why Patrick is like that. They look alike so they’re probably related. That kid doesn’t need a customer facing job if he is going to be acting like that. He needs to work at a library or BOH restaurant where he doesn’t need to interact with people much.

originalText.text: I wandered into this shop, not quite sure what to expect. What I found was a really wonderfully curated selection of secondhand clothes, shoes, and accessories at all price points. If it wasn't such a cold day, I'd definitely spend some time combing the racks and trying things on (but getting dressed back in my winter clothes feels like a workout!).

text.text: I wandered into this shop, not quite sure what to expect. What I found was a really wonderfully curated selection of secondhand clothes, shoes, and accessories at all price points. If it wasn't such a cold day, I'd definitely spend some time combing the racks and trying things on (but getting dressed back in my winter clothes feels like a workout!).

originalText.text: Store has some interesting items. However customer service is giving "elite model agency" that is glad to tell you that you're too fat&old to work with them. Came here with 3 bags of clothes (during horrible weather!) and only wasted 2 hours of my time - right away employee racially profiled me (probably bc accent) and told me that it's only US passport that is valid id, not my passport and that they only accept 2bags of clothes max. Had to call manager to figure out that it's wrong(!). Submitted my stuff and was told to come back in an hour. Came back only to figure out hey never checked my items! And could not even estimate how much longer it'll take. Had to bring everything back home. Never happened to me at beacon's closet or crossroads - they check and estimate $ of items at counter. Don't waste your time there if you're selling - just go somewhere else.
